facts.claim: China, …67 percent. That's tariffs charged to the USA…
facts.correction: According to WTO and USTR data, China's average applied tariff on U.S. goods is roughly 7–8% for many product categories, not 67%.
WTO data show that Vietnam’s tariffs on U.S. products generally fall in the low single digits or low teens—not 90%.
WTO tariff data indicate that Taiwan’s average import duties on U.S. products are very low (around 2–3%), not 64%.
Japan’s overall tariff rates for most industrial products average around 2–3%. While certain sensitive sectors like agriculture may have higher rates, 46% is not representative.
India’s overall MFN tariff rates generally fall around 10–15% for a broad range of goods. Some specific categories may be higher, but not an across-the-board 52%.
Cambodia’s average tariff rate is typically very low (ranging from 0–5%), not 97%.

facts.claim: Effective at midnight, we will impose a 25 percent tariff on all foreign-made automobiles.
facts.correction: While discussions on auto tariffs have been prominent, no official U.S. policy implemented a uniform 25% tariff on all imported automobiles as stated.
